home.testimonial_1: The online Qigong workshop was excellent. Eileen's calm teaching method made it very enjoyable, with ample time for practice and questions.
home.testimonial_2: The Zoom experience was very uplifting with clear instructions and a warm environment. I am now practicing Qigong daily again.
home.testimonial_3: After three sessions I regained full mobility in my shoulder. A deeply healing experience that transformed my wellbeing.
home.testimonial_4: Gong yourself back to life! I felt a complete transformation after the sound bath. The vibrations healed my soul.
home.testimonial_5: The conscious dance sessions helped me reconnect with my body and emotions in a profound and lasting way.

qigong.title: Qigong â€“ Reconnection Through Movement | Gong & Motion
qigong.description: A gentle, meditative practice to harmonise body, mind, and spirit. Join our Qigong workshops for self-healing and reconnection.
qigong.hero_subtitle: A gentle, meditative practice to harmonise body, mind, and spirit.
qigong.what_is_qigong_content:
In our modern lives, many of us spend much of our time in our thoughts, often feeling disconnected from our deeper selves and from the world around us. Qigong offers a way backâ€”a path to reconnection. This gentle, meditative practice has been used for thousands of years to harmonise body, mind, and spirit.

Qigong's true origins stretch far back into ancient China, beyond the reach of clear historical records. While documented references date back around 2,500 years, Chinese historians and archaeologists have found evidence of similar practices as far back as 5,000 years ago.

Over the centuries, Qigong has been known by many names. One of the earliest was Dao Yin, meaning "guiding and leading the energy." The term Qigong itself did not come into common use until the twentieth century.

At its heart, Qigong encourages us to slow down, become present, and reconnectâ€”with ourselves, with others, and with nature. Through regular practice, we begin to move in rhythm with life, cultivating a sense of balance, awareness, and vitality. More than just an exercise, Qigong is a living tradition that supports well-being on every level.
qigong.workshop_intro: Join us for a relaxed and welcoming one-day workshop where you'll learn the simple yet powerful practice of Qigong for self-healing.

workshop_benefits.gentle_movements: Learn gentle, flowing movements that support health and well-being
workshop_benefits.stress_relief: Discover how Qigong can ease stress and promote inner calm
workshop_benefits.guided_practice: Experience guided practice in a supportive and interactive space
workshop_benefits.daily_tools: Gain practical tools to integrate into your daily life

qigong.workshop_note: Qigong is easy to learn and can be adapted for all abilitiesâ€”it can be practiced standing or sitting. Whether you're new to Qigong or have some experience, you are welcome to join!

workshop_details.cost: Cost: â‚¬180 (includes tuition, written materials, audio and practice classes)

qigong.teacher_bio:
Eileen Murray is a Qigong Instructor with over 30 years of experience in mental health. A certified lineage holder of Essence Qigong, she also trains and certifies Qigong teachers.

With a background as a nurse, psychotherapist, Biodynamic bodywork therapist, and Conscious Movement Teacher, Eileen brings a deep understanding of mind-body connection to her teaching. She has worked in Australia, Sweden, the UK, and Ireland, offering a wealth of experience in health and well-being.

testimonials.mary: The online Qigong workshop was a very worthwhile experience. Eileen is an excellent teacher, delivering the course in a thorough yet relaxing way. Her calm teaching method made it very enjoyable, with ample time for practice, discussion, and questions. â€“ Mary, Cork, Ireland
testimonials.joan: The Zoom experience was very uplifting. It offered all the benefits of in-person learning, with clear instructions, a warm and encouraging environment, and ample time for queries. I am now practicing Qigong daily again and so grateful for this experience. â€“ Joan, Sligo, Ireland (80 years old)

experience_needed.question: Do I need previous experience?
experience_needed.answer: No, Qigong is easy to learn and suitable for beginners as well as more experienced practitioners.

limited_mobility.question: Can I practice if I have limited mobility?
limited_mobility.answer: Yes, Qigong can be practiced either standing or sitting, and movements can be adapted to different abilities.

online_requirements.question: What do I need for the online workshop?
online_requirements.answer: A quiet space, comfortable clothing, and a stable internet connection. A chair is also useful if you prefer to practice seated.

qigong.closing_text: Come along and experience the gentle, transformative power of Qigong for yourself. ðŸŒ¿âœ¨

massage.title: Biodynamic Massage â€“ Healing Through Deep Listening | Gong & Motion
massage.description: A gentle body-oriented psychotherapy that harmonises body, mind, and emotions through deep listening and therapeutic touch.
massage.hero_title: Biodynamic Massage â€“ Healing Through Deep Listening
massage.hero_subtitle: A gentle body-oriented psychotherapy that harmonises body, mind, and emotions.
massage.what_is_content:
Biodynamic massage is a therapeutic approach that listens to the body's inner language. During treatment, the therapist uses a stethoscope to follow the intestines' activity â€” showing how the body processes and releases stress.

Developed by Gerda Boyesen, a pioneer of modern body-oriented psychotherapy, this method recognises that unresolved emotions can remain in the body and block the natural flow of life energy. Through biodynamic massage and psychotherapy, these blockages can be released, allowing more vitality, calm, and balance.
massage.benefits_intro: Biodynamic massage is used both as a healing practice and a form of gentle psychotherapy. It can support:

benefits.pain_relief: Relief from pain and back problems
benefits.stress_reduction: Reduction of stress, anxiety, and tension
benefits.life_transitions: Guidance during crisis, life transitions, and change

massage.benefits_conclusion: By integrating experiences and emotions, what once felt like a burden can instead become a source of strength and resilience.
massage.about_eileen_content:
Eileen Murray is a specialised massage therapist and body psychotherapist with over 25 years of experience, and a background in psychiatric nursing since 1980.

She holds a postgraduate qualification in Biodynamic Psychotherapy from the Institute of Biodynamic Medicine. In addition, Eileen is a Medical Qigong teacher and lineage holder, Conscious Dance teacher, and Therapy in Motion practitioner.

She offers individual therapy (live and online), as well as classes and workshops that integrate movement, stillness, and deep listening for holistic healing and transformation.

difference.question: Is biodynamic massage the same as a regular massage?
difference.answer: No. Biodynamic massage is a form of body psychotherapy. It works not only on muscles and tissues, but also on the emotions and stress stored in the body.

who_benefits.question: Who can benefit from biodynamic massage?
who_benefits.answer: It is suitable for anyone experiencing stress, anxiety, tension, depression, physical pain, or those going through life transitions.

online_sessions.question: Can sessions be done online?
online_sessions.answer: Yes. While the hands-on massage is in person, biodynamic psychotherapy sessions can also be offered online.

massage.closing_text: Discover how biodynamic massage and psychotherapy can transform stress into strength and restore emotional balance. ðŸŒ¿

gongbath.title: Gong Bath â€“ Sound Healing for Deep Relaxation | Gong & Motion
gongbath.description: An immersive sound experience to release tension, calm the mind, and restore balance. Book your transformative gong bath session.
gongbath.hero_title: Gong Bath â€“ Sound Healing for Deep Relaxation
gongbath.hero_subtitle: An immersive sound experience to release tension, calm the mind, and restore balance.
gongbath.what_is_content:
A Gong Bath is a sound healing practice where participants are immersed in the deep, resonant tones of the gong.

You simply lie down or sit comfortably while waves of sound gently wash over you, helping the mind to quieten and the body to relax.
gongbath.designed_for_title: This ancient practice is designed to:
gongbath.unique_note: Each session is unique, offering a transformative journey through sound and vibration.

main_benefits.deep_relaxation: Deep relaxation for body and mind
main_benefits.anxiety_relief: Relief from anxiety, stress, and fatigue
main_benefits.spiritual_renewal: A sense of connection and spiritual renewal

gongbath.kari_bio:
Kari Korkeamaki has been playing the gong for over 12 years, offering gong baths in many formats:

â€¢ Yoga classes and festivals
â€¢ Individual sound healing sessions
â€¢ Outdoor sessions in nature
â€¢ Experiences with hypnosis and meditation

He has also assisted with gong work at Open Floor events in Ireland and Sweden.

For Kari, both gong and dance are powerful tools for inner exploration, helping people reconnect with their true selves, release inhibitions, and welcome new energy into life.

experience_needed.question: Do I need any experience to join a Gong Bath?
experience_needed.answer: No. Gong baths are open to everyone, regardless of background or meditation experience.

what_to_bring.question: What should I bring to a session?
what_to_bring.answer: A yoga mat, blanket, and comfortable clothing. You can lie down or sit, whichever feels best.

what_feels_like.question: What does a Gong Bath feel like?
what_feels_like.answer: Many participants experience a deep meditative state, relaxation, emotional release, and renewed clarity.

gongbath.closing_title: Experience the transformative power of sound and vibration
gongbath.contact_info: Book a Gong Bath with Kari:
gongbath.quote: The gong is not an instrument, it is a gateway to the cosmos.

dancingmindfulness.title: Conscious Dance â€“ Mindfulness in Motion | Gong & Motion
dancingmindfulness.description: A practice of mindful movement for self-discovery, connection, and healing through free movement and therapeutic dance.
dancingmindfulness.hero_title: Conscious Dance â€“ Mindfulness in Motion
dancingmindfulness.hero_subtitle: A practice of mindful movement for self-discovery, connection, and healing.
dancingmindfulness.what_is_content:
Conscious Dance is a space where mindfulness and free movement meet. It is an exploration of body, mind, and spirit that supports self-discovery, emotional healing, and personal growth.

Unlike structured dance, there are no steps to follow â€” only an invitation to move freely, reconnect with yourself, and experience the therapeutic power of movement.
dancingmindfulness.benefits_intro: 7 ways conscious dance can support you:

benefits.mind_holiday: A holiday for the mind. Free movement gives the overactive mind a much-needed rest as we drop into the body.
benefits.overcome_blockages: Overcoming blockages. Helps release mental obstacles and opens new pathways for creativity and resilience.
benefits.confidence: Confidence. Improves self-image and self-esteem, while boosting overall presence.
benefits.feel_good_hormones: Feel-good hormones. Dancing increases neuroplasticity, releases endorphins, and even reduces the risk of dementia by 76% (Albert Einstein College of Medicine, New York).
benefits.emotional_strength: Emotional strength. Dance offers a therapeutic way to process stress, depression, and emotions without needing to talk â€” creating freedom physically and emotionally.
benefits.connection: Connection. Moving with others generates joy, belonging, and hope.
benefits.spiritual_creativity: Spiritual connection & creativity. Conscious dance awakens natural creativity and inner power, allowing access to deeper states of awareness and insight.

dancingmindfulness.about_eileen_content:
Eileen Murray has dedicated her life to supporting others on their journey to psychological well-being.

Her professional path began in 1980 as a psychiatric nurse, and over 30 years ago she trained as a body psychotherapist. A few years later, her first conscious movement class profoundly shifted her path, igniting a lifelong dedication to movement as therapy.

Eileen has completed extensive training with:
â€¢ Open Floor International (openfloor.org)
â€¢ Body in Soul Movement (bodyinsoul.be)

She is also a certified Open Floor Therapy in Motion practitioner.

Through one-to-one sessions, classes, and workshops, Eileen creates a space where movement, stillness, and deep listening come together. Her approach is compassionate, steady, and rooted in decades of experience.

experience_needed.question: Do I need dance experience?
experience_needed.answer: No. Conscious dance is open to everyone â€” there are no steps to learn, only movement and presence.

what_needed.question: What do I need for a session?
what_needed.answer: Comfortable clothing, an open mind, and a willingness to move at your own pace.

what_to_expect.question: What can I expect from a class?
what_to_expect.answer: A supportive space with music and guided invitations, where you are free to explore movement, creativity, and connection.

dancingmindfulness.closing_text: Discover the freedom and healing of Conscious Dance. ðŸŒ¿

eileen.name: Eileen Murray
eileen.bio: Eileen Murray is a Qigong teacher, body psychotherapist, and movement facilitator with over 30 years of experience in mental health and holistic well-being. Her work blends movement, stillness, and deep listening to help people reconnect with themselvesâ€”emotionally, mentally, and physically.

kari.name: Kari Korkeamaki
kari.bio:
Has played gong for 12 years and offered many gong baths in various formatsâ€”together with yoga, at festivals, individual sessions, with hypnosis, and outdoors in nature.
Assisted with gong at Open Floor in Ireland and Sweden. Sees both gong and dance as beautiful ways to discover your inner world, free from inhibitions and to let in new, fresh life.
